intro: Eriocnema acaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed eriocnema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, unbranched stem and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Eriocnema acaulis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
